customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Pros
customer_reviews.text: We shoot weddings full time and love our A7rII, A7s, A7II, FS5, and FS7 – but we wanted something smaller and still high quality to carry with us for our own personal life shooting. Having recently spent 3 weeks in Europe with this camera, all I can say is wow. Everything from the 24mp stills to the 4k IBIS video is absolutely fantastic. Doesn't leave me missing any major pro feature in our bigger cameras.

customer_reviews.title: Worthy of the high ratings
customer_reviews.text: There are very valid reasons this camera gets all of the high ratings and accolades. The Sony a6500 is a top-tier APS-C mirrorless camera with 5 axis in body image stabilization, excellent auto focus with 425 phase detection points and 11 fps continuous shooting for up to 300 JPEGs or 100 raw images. These "technical" details increase the chances of more "keepers" - those images worth additional editing.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, but two key features for videographers that are lacking.
customer_reviews.text: I've moved from Canons to Sonys and while I love this power-packed camera, the monitor is the WORST. Even set to bright daylight, don't count on being able to use the built in monitor to see what you're shooting on a sunny day or even overcast outdoor shoot. This is very limiting since I shoot mostly with a gimbal and had to purchase an external monitor. The other thing that doesn't make sense is not having an audio output to monitor audio while recording. The visual feature is pretty good, as long as you know where your range needs to be, but you'll miss little things like the subject bumping their lavalier without using another audio input.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great B-Cam

I'm loving the quality, although in 1080p, I there's some line-skipping that is somewhat noticeable in patterns. Nowhere NEAR as bad as the Canon 7D though, and not enough to really worry about. I also use this almost exclusively on my stabilizer, as the 5-axis stabilization negates any jitter and makes for some great stabilized video.
